properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 6 at 5:20AM HST until February 6 at 8:15AM HST by NWS Honolulu HI
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
The island of Kauai in Kauai County

* Until 815 AM HST.

* At 514 AM HST, the Hanalei stream gauge continues to report high
water levels above flood stage at the Hanalei River Bridge. Kauai
Emergency Management reported flooding over Kuhio Highway in the
vicinity of the Hanalei River Bridge. Kuhio highway near the
bridge is closed. Additional moderate to heavy rainfall will
likely keep water levels in the Hanalei River above flood stage
for the next several hours, with high water levels expected in
Hanakapiai Stream, Kawaikoi Stream, and the Wainiha River.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain.

SOURCE...Emergency management.

IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads,
properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road
closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible
in steep terrain.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Princeville, Wainiha, North Fork Wailua Trails, Hanalei and Na Pali
State Park.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring
within the warned area.

Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even
if they are currently dry.

Do not cross fast flowing water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn
around, don't drown.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 8:15 AM HST. Avoid flooded areas.
